results.abstract: Israeli Brig Gen Dan Shomron, leader of raid on Uganda's Entebbe Airport that freed 102 hijacked hostages, is reptdly being given larger command and promoted; Shomron illus (S)

headline.main: Notes on People; Entebbe Raid Leader Moving Up

results.snippet: Brig. Gen. Dan Shomron, leader of the raid on Entebbe Airport in Uganda, is being given a larger command and promoted to higher rank in the Israeli Army, Tel Aviv sources said yesterday. In a "Paratroop Day" speech to his troops Sunday, General...
results.lead_paragraph: Brig. Gen. Dan Shomron, leader of the raid on Entebbe Airport in Uganda, is being given a larger command and promoted to higher rank in the Israeli Army, Tel Aviv sources said yesterday. In a "Paratroop Day" speech to his troops Sunday, General Shomron said he would be leaving them soon.

results.abstract: Comment on success of Erich von Daniken's books, which maintain that human beings are offspring of super-beings from other planets (S)
results.snippet: ANDY WARHOL, the pop artist, film maker, author and man-about-Manhat-  tan, is now going into publishing. An agreement was concluded between Mr. Warhol and Grosset  Dunlap whereby they will jointly publish books under the imprint Andy Warhol Books/...
results.lead_paragraph: ANDY WARHOL, the pop artist, film maker, author and man-about-Manhat- tan, is now going into publishing. An agreement was concluded between Mr. Warhol and Grosset Dunlap whereby they will jointly publish books under the imprint Andy Warhol Books/ Grosset Dunlap. Mr. Warhol will have a hand in writing and designing some of the books, which Grosset Dunlap will then produce and distribute.

results.abstract: Article on status of women in USSR; level of liberation is not considered high; women have gained access to many professions but are prominent in few; USSR society seen insulated from consciousness-raising forces of feminism existing in the West; both men and women assume women's inferiority and frailty as well as their obligation to keep a home without expecting much help from husband; dissidents also accept this view; women's job problems seen parallel to those in the US; 71% of secondary-school teachers are women, but 72% of principals are men; 70% of drs are women, but heads of hosps and other med facilities are usually men; comment on status of women in various areas (L)

headline.main: Life for the Soviet Woman Is All Hard Work and Little Status

results.snippet: MOSCOW, Aug. 6 Soviet women are bulldozer drivers and ditch diggers, doctors and judges, and occasionally even jet pilots and ship captains. But are they liberated?

byline.original: By DAVID K. SHIPLER Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: MOSCOW, Aug. 6 Soviet women are bulldozer drivers and ditch diggers, doctors and judges, and occasionally even jet pilots and ship captains. But are they liberated?

headline.main: Ousted Cadets Offered Chance to Reapply After a Year; Ousted Cadets Offered Chance to Reapply After a Year

results.snippet: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23-- Secretary of the Army Martin R. Hoffmann intervened today in the West Point cheating scandal by offering guilty cadets who have been ousted the chance to reapply for admission after a one-year period of "reflection," preferably...

byline.original: By JAMES FERON Special to The New York Times

results.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON, Aug. 23-- Secretary of the Army Martin R. Hoffmann intervened today in the West Point cheating scandal by offering guilty cadets who have been ousted the chance to reapply for admission after a one-year period of "reflection," preferably on active service as enlisted men.

results.abstract: Approximately 1,000 women inform NASA of interest in US astronaut corps; women will be among 30 new astronauts to be chosen by July '78 for space shuttle flights in '80s (S)

headline.main: A Thousand Women Inquire About Jobs In Astronaut Corps

results.snippet: HOUSTON, Aug. 26, (UPI) A thousand women have informed the space agency that they may want to join the nation's all-male astronaut corps. And the men who run the nation's space program are delighted.
results.lead_paragraph: HOUSTON, Aug. 26, (UPI) A thousand women have informed the space agency that they may want to join the nation's all-male astronaut corps. And the men who run the nation's space program are delighted.
